.
Effect of a Dependent’s Incarceration on a Beneficiary’s Award
38 CFR 3.666
requires the removal of an incarcerated dependent from a beneficiary’s award if the beneficiary receives
pension
.  There is no such requirement, however, if the beneficiary is a
Veteran receiving disability compensation, or
surviving spouse receiving DIC.
References
:  For more information on
removing an incarcerated dependent from a pension award, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.C.1
the effect of an
apportionee’s
incarceration on the apportionment, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.C.6
, and
dependents that are fugitive felons, see
M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, 1.A.1.g
.
title: M21-1, Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section A - Effects of an Individual’s Incarceration on Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) Benefits
citation: Part VI, Subpart iii, Chapter 1, Section A
